nested.name: jsx3.util.DateFormat
nested.text: Formats and parses dates according to a token-based string format.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Dojo
nested.text: Provides the ability to load the Dojo JavaScript library.

nested.name: jsx3.util.List
nested.text: An object-oriented version of the built-in JavaScript Array class.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Locale
nested.text: Represents a region of the world.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Logger
nested.text: A Logger is used to log messages about a particular component of an application.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Logger.AlertHandler
nested.text: Handles a logging record by sending it to a JavaScript alert.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Logger.ConsoleHandler
nested.text: Handles a logging record by sending it to the Firebug console.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Logger.FormatHandler
nested.text: A subclass of Handler that includes functionality for formatting logging records as human-readable strings.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Logger.Manager
nested.text: Manager class for the logging system.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Logger.MemoryHandler
nested.text: A simple Handler class that stores a rotating cache of log records in memory.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Logger.Record
nested.text: Record bean that stores information about a logging message.

nested.name: jsx3.util.MessageFormat
nested.text: Constructs messages from a pattern and parameters.

nested.name: jsx3.util.EventDispatcher
nested.text: An Event Dispatcher mixin interface, adds the ability to register event listeners and dispatch events to those listeners.

nested.name: jsx3.util.Iterator
nested.text: An interface that defines an object that can be iterated over.

method.name: arrIndexOf
method.text: Returns the array index of o in a. Comparisons are performed with strict equals (===).

method.name: isName
method.text: Returns true if n is a valid JavaScript name and not a JavaScript reserved word.

method.name: numMod

return.text: a mod b if a >= 0, b + a mod b, if a < 0.

method.text: Calculates a mod b, but the result is not allowed to be negative.

method.name: numRound
method.text: Rounds v to the nearest value that can be divided by intUnit.

method.name: strDecodeBase64
method.text: Returns the result of decoding s from its base-64 equivalent.

method.name: strEmpty
method.text: Returns whether s is null or an empty string.

method.name: strEncodeBase64
method.text: Returns the result of encoding s to its base-64 equivalent.

method.name: strEndsWith
method.text: Returns whether s ends with strTest.

method.name: strEscapeHTML
method.text: Returns s with the following four characters replaced by their escaped equivalent: & < > ". This method also replaces any character that is not a valid XML character (valid character codes are: 0x09, 0x0A, 0x0D, 0x20-0xD7FF, 0xE000-0xFFFD, 0x10000-0x10FFFF) with "\uXX" where XX is the unicode hex value of the character.

method.name: strEscapeJSON
method.text: Returns str appropriately formatted and escaped for use as a JSON string. If evaluated via window.eval, the return from this method will be an exact match of the input.

method.name: strTrim
method.text: Returns s trimmed of trailing and leading spaces (anything matching the regexp /\s/).

method.name: strTruncate

param.name: intMax
param.text: the maximum length of the string returned by this method.

param.name: strEllipsis
param.text: the ellipsis to use. "..." is used by default.

param.name: fltPos
param.text: the placement of the ellipsis as a value between 0 and 1. 1, the default, means that the ellipsis comes at the end of the truncated string. Other values mean that the head and tail of the string will be returned with the ellipsis somewhere in the middle.

method.text: Limits s to length intMax by placing an ellipsis in values that are too long.
